reference.title: tasktroubleshooting
reference.shortdesc: The <tasktroubleshooting> element provides users remedies for resolving problems that occur when tasks do not complete as expected. In particular, this element can be used to explain how users can recover when the results of a task do not match those listed in the <result> element. The troubleshooting remedy typically contains one or more actions for solving a problem. Linking to another task is recommended for complex remedies.

note.p: Do not use <note type=”troubleshooting”> inside of <tasktroubleshooting> because its meaning there would be ambiguous.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.pre:
. . .

The User Type menu updates to display the new types you added.

If the User Type menu does not display the additions, try one or more of the following:

  • Refresh the page
  • Verify that Add Types is not still open; if so, go to it and press OK.

For example, you could also do xyz.

Once completed, you need to consider abc.
